content:
rape ought to allow the un-
born person to use her body for the hour he needs, we should not conclude
that he has a right to do so; we should conclude that she is self-centered,
callous, indecent, but not unjust, if she refuses. The complaints are no less
grave; they are just different. However, there is no need to insist on this
point. If anyone does wish to deduce “he has a right” from “you ought,”
then all the same he must surely grant that there are cases in which it is not
morally required
